title: Publications
text: My research focuses on Science of Science, Complex Networks, and Academic Career Development. I use data-driven approaches to understand how mentorship, team size, and network structures affect scientific survival and success in the life-course view.

title: Yanmeng Xing
text:
I am an independent Principal Investigator (PI) at the Data Management Innovation Research Center, Nanjing University. My research expertise lies in Scientometrics, Science & Technology Policy, and Complex Networks. I am particularly interested in the career development paths of young scholars and the mechanisms of academic mentorship.
My recent research, published in Nature Human Behaviour, explores how academic group size influences mentee success. This work has been highlighted by Nature News: ‚ÄúHow to pick a mentor: what the data say‚Äù.
Currently, I am leading a project funded by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC) Youth Fund focusing on the evolution of scientific research careers.
